Questions.questionText: The Right to Freedom includes the freedom of speech and expression.
The Right to Constitutional Remedies is not considered a Fundamental Right.
The Right to Education is a Fundamental Right in India.
Fundamental Duties were originally a part of the Constitution when it was enacted in 1950.
One of the Fundamental Duties is to protect and improve the natural environment.
The Right to Privacy is explicitly mentioned as a Fundamental Right in the Constitution.
It is the duty of every citizen to safeguard public property.
Fundamental Rights can be suspended during a National Emergency.
Every citizen is entitled to form associations or unions as per the Constitution.
The right to work is one of the Fundamental Rights listed in the Constitution.
